titleInfo.title: American Association v. Eastern Kentucky Land Company, et al map exhibit (1891)

mods.abstract: A map drafted on paper with an architectural fabric backing. It is depicts a portion of land in Cumberland Gap and Harrogate, TN, near the Virginia state line and the Cumberland Gap. Numerous streets and building lots are visible, as are sections of the Louisville & Nashville Railroad and the Knoxville, Cumberland Gap, & Louisville Railroad. The lots which had been sold appear shaded and the buildings are indicated by solid black. Also depicted in the map are the Lands of the East KY Land Co., Lands of Association, and the boundaries of the Harrogate Land and Cumberland Gap Park Companies.
The case involves efforts to have pipe lines removed from the streets of Cumberland Gap, TN, and from the plaintiff's Virginia lands.
